Detailed Description

Dispatcher Task.

This task sits at the top of the protocol stream and dispatches any incoming packets based on the opcode sent.

Member Function Documentation

virtual int Dispatch_Task::close ( u_long flags ) [virtual]
 

Close the process.

close() is invoked when the stream is closed (flags will be set to '1') and when the svc() method exits (flags will be '0').

Reimplemented from Protocol_Task.

OpCode_Map_t & Dispatch_Task::opcode_map ( void ) [inline, protected]
 

Accessor for opcode_map_.

virtual int Dispatch_Task::open ( int _threads = 0 ) [virtual]
 

open() is invoked when the task is inserted into the stream.

threads indicated the number of threads to spawn for this task.

  • If threads == 0, then no threads will be spawns, and control of the thread calling the put method will be given to this task.
  • If threads != 0, then each spawned thread will start up in the svc function, and wait for messages to process. In this case, calling put will put the message into the message queue and return control to the caller.

Reimplemented from Protocol_Task.

int Dispatch_Task::register_opcode ( ACE_UINT16 key,
OpCode_Task * value ) [virtual]
 

Register an application level opcode.

This is used to tell the application which opcodes to handle. Memory management is taken care of by the Dispatch_Task. Do not deallocate OpCode_Task objects registered with this function, as they will be removed when close() is called.

int Dispatch_Task::svc ( void ) [protected, virtual]
 

Thread service handler.

We need to override the service handler to propogate shutdown message properly.

Reimplemented from Protocol_Task.
